meaningMnemonic: This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>fall</kanji> and the vocab verb version means <vocabulary>to fall down</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>to fall</vocabulary>, and <vocabulary>to drop</vocabulary>. It can also mean <vocabulary>to fail</vocabulary>, in the sense of failing an exam.
readingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you: 

If you start <vocabulary>to fall down</vocabulary>, what do you yell? "<reading>OHHHH</reading> (お)!"
